titleInfo.title: Letter No. 21 to William Hornby, President and Governor, Council at Bombay, from John Beaumont at Bushire

physicalDescription.extent: A slim portion of text is missing on the right-hand side of Page 15.

mods.abstract: The letter reports the arrival of the AssistanceSnow (with goods from Bengal, Bombay and Surat) under command of Captain John Johnston. The Assistancehad been attacked by Galfar forces 14 days previous. The SuccessKetch is also reported to have been attacked by a group of Galfar ships, a group that included the recently captured English vessel. The letter also reports news that Shaikh Rashed had demanded more than the 2,000 rupees offered by the intermediary Saffir for the return of the captured vessel. Shipped by the AssistanceSnow.
